articles.headline: Bill O’Reilly Is Forced Out at Fox News
articles.snippet: The exposure of multiple settlements involving sexual harassment allegations against Mr. O’Reilly brought an abrupt end to his two-decade career at Fox.
articles.abstract: The exposure of multiple settlements involving sexual harassment allegations against Mr. O’Reilly brought an abrupt end to his two-decade career at Fox.
articles.lead_paragraph: Bill O’Reilly’s reign as the top-rated host in cable news came to an abrupt and embarrassing end on Wednesday as Fox News forced him out after the disclosure of a series of sexual harassment allegations against him and an internal investigation that turned up even more.
articles.byline: By Emily Steel and Michael S. Schmidt

articles.headline: After Georgia’s Close Race, Montana Democrats Demand Party’s Attention
articles.snippet: The special election to fill Montana’s empty House seat is next, and after a Democrat nearly won a Georgia seat outright, Big Sky Democrats ask, “What about us?”
articles.abstract: The special election to fill Montana’s empty House seat is next, and after a Democrat nearly won a Georgia seat outright, Big Sky Democrats ask, “What about us?”
articles.lead_paragraph: BOZEMAN, Mont. — Rob Quist surveyed his audience last week at an annual powwow of Montana’s Native American tribes, a kaleidoscope of feathers, moccasins and beads, before turning his thoughts to a very different audience, far to the east: the national Democratic Party.

articles.headline: For Fox News, Life After Bill O’Reilly Will Feature Tucker Carlson
articles.snippet: Mr. Carlson has been tapped to replace Mr. O’Reilly at 8 p.m. Eastern. The round-table show “The Five” will take over Mr. Carlson’s 9 p.m. slot.
articles.abstract: Mr. Carlson has been tapped to replace Mr. O’Reilly at 8 p.m. Eastern. The round-table show “The Five” will take over Mr. Carlson’s 9 p.m. slot.
articles.lead_paragraph: For Fox News, there is one big question: What does life after Bill O’Reilly look like?
articles.byline: By Michael M. Grynbaum and John Koblin

articles.headline: Macron Wants to Change France. But Will Voters Elect an Unknown?
articles.snippet: Emmanuel Macron has no political party to speak of and has never held elected office, but he is one of the front-runners in Sunday’s election.
articles.abstract: Emmanuel Macron has no political party to speak of and has never held elected office, but he is one of the front-runners in Sunday’s election.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGNÈRES-DE-BIGORRE, France — In the final days before France’s presidential election on Sunday, Emmanuel Macron was tramping through the snow high in the mountains near the Spanish border for a critical campaign stop near this tiny village where his grandparents once lived.

articles.headline: Bill O’Reilly’s Ouster Will Test Loyalties of Fox Viewers
articles.snippet: Fans have stood by him amid a series of allegations. Now, after the network they have trusted has decided not to do the same, they may turn to alternatives.
articles.abstract: Fans have stood by him amid a series of allegations. Now, after the network they have trusted has decided not to do the same, they may turn to alternatives.
articles.lead_paragraph: No two people did more to build Fox News Channel into a powerful cultural-political force than Roger Ailes and Bill O’Reilly.

articles.headline: Murdoch’s Defiance Over O’Reilly Gives Way to Pragmatism
articles.snippet: Rupert Murdoch prizes loyalty and profits, both of which his former Fox News host brought him in droves, but he has also proved that his hand can be forced.
articles.abstract: Rupert Murdoch prizes loyalty and profits, both of which his former Fox News host brought him in droves, but he has also proved that his hand can be forced.
articles.lead_paragraph: Rupert Murdoch stood behind his top American asset, the anchor Bill O’Reilly of Fox News, for years, shrugging off a sexual harassment scandal in the mid-2000s and multiple complaints about Mr. O’Reilly’s behavior that surfaced behind closed doors.

articles.headline: Trump Adviser’s Visit to Moscow Got the F.B.I.’s Attention
articles.snippet: The visit by Carter Page last July was a significant trigger for the F.B.I. investigation into connections between Russia and President Trump’s campaign.
articles.abstract: The visit by Carter Page last July was a significant trigger for the F.B.I. investigation into connections between Russia and President Trump’s campaign.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Ever since F.B.I. investigators discovered in 2013 that a Russian spy was trying to recruit an American businessman named Carter Page, the bureau maintained an occasional interest in Mr. Page. So when he became a foreign policy adviser to the Trump campaign last year and gave a Russia-friendly speech at a prestigious Moscow institute, it soon caught the bureau’s attention.
articles.byline: By Scott Shane, Mark Mazzetti and Adam Goldman

articles.headline: I.R.S. Enlists Debt Collectors to Recover Overdue Taxes
articles.snippet: In a program that consumer advocates fear has the potential for abuse, private firms are poised to begin calling taxpayers who owe money to Uncle Sam.
articles.abstract: In a program that consumer advocates fear has the potential for abuse, private firms are poised to begin calling taxpayers who owe money to Uncle Sam.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Internal Revenue Service is about to start using four private debt-collection companies to chase down overdue payments from hundreds of thousands of people who owe money to the federal government, a job it has handled in house for years.
articles.byline: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Stacy Cowley
